gurmukhi: ਅਨੰਤ ਸੁਰਸੁਤੀ ਸਤੀ ॥ ਬਦੰਤ ਕ੍ਰਿਤ ੲੀਸੁਰੀ ॥
translation: Innumerable Sarswatis goddess and Satis (Parvati-goddess); and Lakshmis goddess and Satis (Parvati-goddess); and Lakshmis goddess sing His Praises.

gurmukhi: ਅਨੰਤ ਅਨੰਤ ਭਾਖੀਅੈ ॥ ਅਨੰਤ ਅਨੰਤ ਲਾਖੀਅੈ ॥੨੫॥੧੦੩॥
translation: Innumerable Sheshanaga eulogize Him; that Lord is comprehended as infinite ultimeately.25.103.

gurmukhi: ਅਨਾਦਿ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਬਿਅਾਧਿ ਅਾਦਿ ਅਨਾਦਿ ਕੋ ਮਨਾੲੀਅੈ ॥
transliteration: Anaadh Agaddh(i) Biaadh(i) Aadh Anaadh Ko Manaaeeai||
translation: He is Beginningless, Unfathomable and Source of all beings; that Beginningless Lord be worshipped.

gurmukhi: ਅਗੰਜ ਅਭੰਜ ਅਰੰਜ ਅਗੰਜ ਗੰਜ ਕੳੁ ਧਿਅਾੲੀਅੈ ॥
transliteration: Agadj Abhanj Aranj Agadj Gadj Kau Dhiaaeeai||
translation: He is Indestructible, Unbreakable, griefless and Inexhaustible teasure, He should be meditated upon.

gurmukhi: ਅਲੇਖ ਅਭੇਖ ਅਦ੍ਵੈਖ ਅਰੇਖ ਕੋ ਪਛਾਨੀਅੈ ॥
transliteration: Alekh Abhekh Advaikhdarekh Asekh Ko Pachhaadeeai||
translation: He is accountless, guiseless, without blemish, without mark nd without a remander, He should be recognized.

gurmukhi: ਨ ਭੂਲ ਜੰਤ੍ਰ ਤੰਤ੍ਰ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਭਰਮ ਭੇਖ ਠਾਨੀਅੈ ॥੧॥੧੦੪॥
transliteration: Na Bhool Jantra Tantra Mantra Bharam Bhekh Thaaneeai||1||104||
translation: Even by mistake He should not be considered in Yantras, tantrasa, mantras, illusions and guises.1.104.

gurmukhi: ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਲ ਲਾਲ ਅਕਾਲ ਅਪਾਲ ਦੲਿਅਾਲ ਕੋ ੳੁਚਾਰੀਅੈ ॥
transliteration: Kridaal Laal Akaal Apaal Daiaal Ko Oucdareeai||
translation: The Name of that Lord be uttered who is Merciful, Beloved, deathless, Patronless and Compassionate.

gurmukhi: ਅਧਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਧਰਮ ਭਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਮੈ ਬਿਚਾਰੀਅੈ ॥
transliteration: Adharam Karam Dharma Bharam Karam Mai Bicdareeai||
translation: We should reflect upon Him in all works whether irreligious, or fallacious.

gurmukhi: ਅਨੰਤ ਦਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨਵਾਨ ਪੇਖੀਅੈ ॥
transliteration: Anant Daan Dhiaan Giaan Dhiaanvaan Pekheeai||
translation: We should visualize Him in Infinite charities, in contemplation, in knowledge and in those who contemplate.

gurmukhi: ਅਧਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਕੇ ਬਿਨਾ ਸੁ ਧਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਲੇਖੀਅੈ ॥੨॥੧੦੫॥
transliteration: Adharam Karam Ke Binaa Su Dharma Karam Lekheeai||2||105||
translation: Forsaking the irreligious Karms, we should comprehend the Karms that are religious and spiritual.2.105.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਰਤਾਦਿ ਦਾਨ ਸੰਜਮਾਦਿ ਤੀਰਥ ਦੇਵ ਕਰਮਣੰ ॥
transliteration: Brataadh Kounj Med Raajsoo Binaa Na Bharamanndng||
translation: The Karmas which come in the categories of fasts etc., charities, restraints etc., bathing at pilgrim-stations and worship of gods;

gurmukhi: ਹੈ ਅਾਦਿ ਕੁੰਜ ਮੇਦ ਰਾਜਸੂ ਬਿਨਾ ਨ ਭਰਮਣੰ ॥
transliteration: Hai Aadh Karam Bhekh Anek Bhekh Maaneeai||
translation: Which are to be performed without illusion including the horse-sacrifice, elephant-sacrifice and Rajsu sacrifice performed by a universal monarch;

gurmukhi: ਨਿਵਲ ਅਾਦਿ ਕਰਮ ਭੇਖ ਅਨੇਕ ਭੇਖ ਮਾਨੀਅੈ ॥
transliteration: Nival Aadh Karam Bhekh Anek Bhekh Maaneeai||
translation: And the Neoli Karma of Yogis (cleansing of intestines) etc., may all be considered as Karmas of various sects and guises.
